duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinates and schedules installations performed by the mechanical, electrical/controls, HVAC, plumbing, and fire protection contractors.
Provides overall direction and control of the installation of all electrical, plumbing, mechanical, sheet metal, insulation, sprinkler systems, and life safety systems.
Evaluates the complexity of the mechanical/electrical design and estimates both the construction costs and maintenance.
Serves as a technical resource in meeting with owners and architects, discussing the mechanical/electrical systems within the building in technical terms.
Attends weekly meetings with owners, architects, and subcontractors and outlines work to be performed by the mechanical and electrical subcontractors.
Ensures that all mechanical/electrical shop drawings are submitted by the subs in a timely manner and examines all shop drawings for completeness.
Plans the daily and weekly activities for each craft within the construction schedule and provides detailed technical instructions for each foreman.
Inspects all field construction work in progress, including subcontracted work, and ensures that uniformly high-quality workmanship is maintained during each construction segment.

Resolves any technical problems encountered with the architect and inspects and coordinates the installation of all life safety systems, smoke evacuation systems, pressurized portions of the building, etc.
Reviews all change orders carefully to ensure that building code requirements are met and that cost estimates are reasonable and customary.
Refers recurring problems to the MEP Manager for resolution.
Performs detailed inspections of work in progress to ensure quality of installation, and to ensure adequacy of the system.
Plans the daily and weekly activities for each craft within the construction schedule and provides detailed technical instructions for each foreman.
Assists the Project Manager as necessary in estimating change orders and provides technical guidance and assistance in resolving day to day construction problems encountered.
Establishes contact early with city fire department inspectors and reviews all shop drawings and ensures their adequacy and completeness to meet local codes.
Inspects piping during installation and ensures that required insulation is placed correctly and reviews exposed pipe for heat tracing and freeze protection.
Inspects all work in progress for quality and completeness.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in related field preferred but not required.
